questions.question: A tax credit is more valuable than a deduction because:
questions.explanation: Tax credits reduce your tax bill dollar-for-dollar, while deductions only reduce taxable income (worth less).

questions.question: Long-term capital gains are taxed at:
questions.explanation: Long-term capital gains (assets held >1 year) are taxed at preferential rates (0%, 15%, or 20%) compared to ordinary income rates.

questions.question: An HSA offers:
questions.explanation: HSAs offer triple tax advantage: pre-tax contributions, tax-free growth, and tax-free withdrawals for medical expenses.

questions.question: Tax-loss harvesting means:
questions.explanation: Tax-loss harvesting involves selling investments at a loss to offset capital gains and reduce tax liability.

questions.question: Roth accounts are best when:
options: you expect lower tax rate in retirement
you expect higher tax rate in retirement
questions.explanation: Roth accounts are ideal when you expect to be in a higher tax bracket in retirement, as withdrawals are tax-free.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of holding investments longer than 1 year?
acceptable_answers: qualify for long-term capital gains rates
questions.explanation: Holding investments longer than 1 year qualifies them for long-term capital gains rates, which are lower than ordinary income rates.

questions.question: Name one tax-inefficient investment that belongs in a tax-advantaged account:
questions.explanation: Tax-inefficient investments like bonds (interest taxed as income) and REITs (high dividends) benefit from tax-advantaged accounts.
